Description: Fragment of a blue glazed composition vessel (?).
Curator's comments: Possibly a sherd from one of the "many varieties of 'pilgrim bottles' of green or yellow paste, with necks of lotus and palm patterns, some very graceful, and wreathed around the body with very varied patterns" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 75 § 72.
Bibliographic references: Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.53, p.174, pl.16)
